boardgame.name: Sixteen
식스틴
boardgame.description:
Game1 - Sixteen

-Goal of the Game Be the first player to get rid of all your tiles faster than others OR have the least tiles at the end of the game.

The remaining tiles are minus(-) points.


-Contents
1. Number tiles from 1 to 16, 16 Restart & 16 End Tiles (5 colors, 85 tiles total)
2. Function Tiles : 2 Scissors Tiles, 1 Wastebasket Tile
3. Blind patch (4) : The game manual is on this.
4. Pouch (1)

-How to play

1. Put all the tiles into the pouch.
* 22 tiles for 4 players, 29 tiles for 3 players, 30 tiles for 2 players
* Do not use the rest of the tiles.

2. Each player gets tiles from the pouch. And if you have number 1 tile,
place it on the table to make the first tile of the row.

3. The player who placed Red 1 tile starts the game.

4. On your turn, you can place one of your tiles OR consecutive number tiles
on the same colored row.

If you don’t have a tile to place, the turn goes to the next.

(e.g. You don’t have to put just number 2 tile after number 1 tile.
You can place number 3 or consecutive numbers 7,8,9.)

5. When the 16 End tile is placed, nobody can add tile(s) on that row until the
Scissors tile or Wastebasket tile removes the tile(s).

6. When the 16 Restart tile is placed, the row will be reset like the beginning.
And the turn goes to the next.

-Function Tiles
-Scissors Tile
You can cut one tile at the end of the row and place tiles on the row.
-Wastebasket Tile
Cut as many tiles as you can except number 1 tile on the row and place
tiles on that.

-End of the Game
1. The game is over when one of the player gets rid of all his/her tiles.
2. The game ends when nobody can place tiles on the table any more.

-Scoring
The remaining tiles are all minus(-) points.
The player to have the least sum of the tiles is the winner.
If the function tiles(scissors or wastebasket) are left in your hand, they are
counted as 20 minus(-) points each.

Game2 - Sixteen plus

Goal of the Game
Be the first player to shout ‘Sixteen’ by putting all your tiles(16 ea) on your board faster than others.

Rule of the Game
The tiles must be placed in ascending order from left to right and from
bottom to top.

Function Tiles

Scissors Tile


You can get rid of one tile on the board of one of the other players’.
* Wastebasket Tile
You can exchange the whole tiles of the one row on your board.

-How to play

1. Put all the tiles into the pouch and deal 1 board to each player.
2. From the first player, do one of the following actions.

-Get one tile from the pouch OR from the discarded pile, you can place it on
your board OR discard it next to the pouch.
-Get one tile from the pouch OR from the discarded pile, you can exchange it
with one tile on your board.

3. The game is over when one of the player shouts ‘sixteen’ by putting all
his/her tiles on the board.

Adventure Games: The Dungeon
어드벤처 게임: 던전
boardgame.description:
Explore places, combine items, and experience stories in Adventure Games, a series of co-operative games from German publisher KOSMOS. In each of these titles, players are presented with a mysterious story that they must unravel over the course of play. Working together, players explore common areas, talk to people, look for clues, and combine various items to reveal the secret of the story. Depending on what decisions the players make, the course of history changes and there is no going back!

Unlike the co-operative EXIT: The Game series, titles in this series focus on the telling and discovery of the story with no time pressure. That said, many different paths can be experienced during play, with more than one correct resolution to the story waiting to be discovered. Each title consists of three chapters, each taking about 75 minutes to play. Nothing is destroyed, so the games can be played multiple times.

In The Dungeon, the players awaken in a prison cell in the middle ages with no memory of how they got there. What happened? What strange things are taking place in this dungeon? And most importantly, how can they get out? Over three chapters, players will jointly explore rooms, combine objects, and perhaps even encounter creatures that lurk in the dark rooms of the old castle...

boardgame.name: Darkwood Adventure Arc 3: The Vile and the Voracious
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

“The Vile and the Voracious” is the third adventure in a 5-book Adventure Arc for PCs levels 9-11. This product is compatible with The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. The Vile and the Voracious is set in the booming prospect town of Darkwood. The third exciting installment of the Darkwood Adventure Arc finds the boomtown of Darkwood facing the threat of invasion by vicious, mutated trolls. It is up to the PCs to venture into the dangerous Trollmaw Hills, locate their lair and end the mutant menace once and for all. Not all is as it seems though, for dark powers and remnants of the past make the PC's job even harder.

This HUGE 170-page adventure begins in Darkwood, a frontier town filled with intrigue and danger. After fielding offers from the various factions in town to rid the region of the troll threat, the PCs embark on a treacherous expedition into the Trollmaw Hills. After finding the lair of the mutant trolls on Rockguzzle Crag the PCs must delve into the strange caves and caverns in which they live. Here they encounter the remnants of the Mockers, a group of powerful fey who ruled the land over 10,000 years before. After adventuring through multiple levels, solving puzzles and fighting many exotic enemies the PCs must face the terrible troll-- Zulshir, the Cannibal King.

boardgame.name: Cuckoo Eggs
boardgame.description:
→ Board in colors suited to the colors of the balls
→ Two sets of balls – each has 16 balls of the same color

Basic Rules
Each move consist of putting one of your ball to the board (put) and pushing one of your active ball so it will move one field (push). At the end you check for the lines, than for the triangles (pull).

Goal of the game is to capture oponent balls.
You can achieve that in three different ways:

Catch the opponent's ball using your 3 balls arranged in the form of a triangle (triangle). If the opponet’s ball is not active it is considered as sucesfully surrounded and it is removed from the board.
Push one of the ball outside the board (point) – pushed out ball will be taken by the player who did that move. If this is opponent ball it is considered as captured and it is removed from the game. In case player pushed out his own ball it will go back to his “hand” and can be added to the board again in future.
Through the line alignment of the at least five balls in their own color (line).
a. A line of five balls – opponent gives away three balls of his choice
b. A line of six balls – opponent gives away six balls of his choice
c. A line of seven balls – this ends game instantly by glorious win

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Siege: Clan War
boardgame.description:
The Scorpion Clan has been dissolved. The Lion Champion has been disgraced. The Emperor lies dying of the plague, and the Great Clans eye the throne with jealous spirits. It is an age of duty, and age of honor, and age of ambition, and an age of war. It is the era of the great Clan War. The Black Scrolls are being opened, and the forces of the Shadowlands have forged an alliance with ancient enemies among the Crab in an attempt to gain entrance into the Empire.
Who will emerge victorious at the most famous battles in history? Who will defend Rokugan, and who will see it fall?

Siege: Clan War takes us back in time to the era of the Great Clan War! The Black Scrolls are being opened and soon Fu Leng shall be released on the Empire. Come together with other players to defeat a dark god. During this time of political treachery and military honor you are called to lead the Siege on the Throne Room and vanquish Fu Leng if your army has the capability to overcome the physical and mental challenges that lay ahead of you.

Features:

Multiplayer format, pitting 3+ players against one.
New way to discover Rokugan and the world of Legend of the Five Rings.
Relive the defining era in the history of the game as part of the celebration of 20 years of L5R.
Fantastic art from fan favorite artists such as Jason Behnke, Sergio Camarena, Charles Urbach, Mario Wibisono and more!

boardgame.name: Civilian Authority of Brinston
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the party returns home, or to any city, they want to relax, have a drink, and typically get into trouble. Whether that trouble is a bar fight, picking pockets, or threatening the local merchants who are gouging them, the city guards are going to show up - what then? Are your PCs in any way concerned about what the city guard wants or do they “know” they can take these guys in a fight?

These types of problems have been a part of FRPGs since they began. When a single fireball can wipe out an entire squad of guardsmen, what can you as a GM do to force the adventurers to be on their best behavior, without making the police incredibly, and unrealistically, powerful? That is the whole point of this edition of Small Bites.

This edition is set in the city of Brinston, but it is written in a generic style that will allow you to easily use these ideas, characters and units in any setting for any game.

If you’re looking for a ton of new ideas, ideas you can easily use in your existing game world or use to craft a new game world, then Small Bites is what you’re looking for. Our goal is to take a subject, whether an archetype, a monster class, or some other FRPG theme and bring you as much content about it as we can. But this isn’t a simple one-shot supplement. We want to get you involved in the process - giving us the themes you want most, the articles you like the best, and the feedback we need to make you happy.

This is the “World Walker” edition. The Game Master edition gives you even more, including ideas about campaigns, enemy characters, and world building. We know that veteran and starting players and game masters are all going to find things they can use, and ideas to spark their characters, campaigns and game worlds! Come on - You’ve got nothing to lose!

boardgame.name: Afohdha, the Lady of the Well
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The well’s aquifer runs for miles underground, spanning rivers and cisterns to bring life to the land. Generations of farmers coaxed the water above ground, and rice and grains that grow nowhere else in the East paid for gilded thrones. Three principalities once waged war over Afondha’s Well, dark blood seeping through earth to mingle with the water. Now they have reached an equilibrium through treaties and marriage, so each may prosper.

Afondha is a regional fertility goddess. She has scores of god-blooded children, begotten with men and women from all three princedoms, whom she views as extensions of herself. They fill her retinue as guards, servants, spies, and — for those born of prestigious mortal lineages — ambassadors. She has no patience for rebellion or laziness, and swiftly disowns any children who refuse to play their parts. Any who actively betray her, or even speak badly about her in public, can look forward to unfriendly visits from hireling slavers, assassins, or in some cases their own siblings.

boardgame.name: The Living Building
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Just after dawn, a village scout dashed from the forest carrying a wondrous, and perhaps even terrifying, story of a huge, circular shell with a door, a massive coiled building that sprang up during the night. And it is still growing … ”

Whether from forgetfulness, mental blockage, or intrusions of the dread “real life,” every storyteller has probably experienced that sinking, not-so-prepared feeling before a game. This sourcebook provides a remedy for the next time that happens, and includes an adventure location that is both a little pre-generated and a little homemade, is immediately expandable and adaptable, and can be replayed without seeming like a re-run, because the building changes even as the characters explore it.

“The Living Building” includes background and physical description for the title structure; a floorplan for a particular living building; problems with living buildings that can make them interesting and dangerous places to explore; tips on using living buildings in game sessions; tables for determining the contents of rooms; hazards that characters might face in living buildings; and a section on monsters particularly likely to be encountered in living buildings that includes four new creatures and three new mutations.

Material in this publication was written specifically for the Mutant Future retroclone of Gamma World and can be used as-is with it and any other sci-fi, fantasy, or post-apocalyptic games that use the "Basic" version of the OGL system, and easily adapted to other games using the same core rules. It was written by noted game developer Derek Holland and includes cartography by artist William T. Thrasher.

boardgame.name: Redaktion Wadenbeisser: Die Jagd nach der Titelstory
boardgame.description:
The players are reporters for a school magazine and try to catch the newest „title story“ for it.
So they chase through the city trying to be the first.
The game comes with two game modes.
1. players play clockwise and either collect cards or play them and collect tokens from the board matching the color of the blueprint of their story. When one of the three parts of the story is full, they look at the card for ca. 30 seconds and try to memorize as much as possible.
They are asked a question in the vein of „what is the kid in the background eating?“ and if they guess it right they keep the card.
The first to collect enough tokens and to answer the three cards correctly wins.

2. there are 8 decks of cards available and the players take a deck and search for cards that point in the right direction in their own player color, they program simultaneously their path through the city and try to get to the colored tokens. In player order they check if they collect enough tokens to try to answer a question.
When all three cards are fulfilled the player who has all three cards in front of himself wins.

—user summary

In Llamas in Pyjamas, players take turns to take a card from the pile and try to match llama pyjama tops with pyjama bottoms. Collect more pyjama bottoms, match a pyjama top to existing pyjama bottoms, and complete as many llamas as possible before all of the “bedtime scene” cards are revealed.

Watch out for those “a-llama clock” cards which can send half of a completed llama to the discard pile.

The winner is the player with the greatest number of complete llamas at bedtime.

boardgame.name: Little Collect
boardgame.description:
This children's game teaches the basics of set collection.

On a player's turn, players draw a card and take the corresponding action:
If the card depicts a carrot, the player adds a carrot to their player board.
If the card depicts a set of peas, the player adds a pea to their player board.
If the card depicts a bunny eating a carrot, and the player already has at least one carrot, the player adds a bunny to their player board.
If the card depicts a bunny eating a pea, and the player already has at least one pea, the player adds a bunny to their player board.
If the card depicts a fox, and the player has at least one bunny on their player board, then the player must return one bunny to the supply.

Players take turns drawing cards until one player has 3 carrots, 3 peas, and 3 bunnies on their player board, and that player then wins.
—user summary

A collection game: The little rabbits are greedy and if you want to approach them, you will first need to harvest some peas and carrots! But watch out for the fox who's on the prowl! Will you be the first to fill your board? A first collecting game to play with your Mum or Dad!
—description from the back of the box

boardgame.name: Tatters of the Titan Scroll
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sharn, City of Towers, hides secrets aplenty amidst its wonders and splendor, and sometimes those secrets crawl back to the surface. A strange summons sends a party of heroes on the search for remnants of a stone-like scroll broken up long ago, but others also seek the prize. Finding the Titan Scroll puts the characters in the path of danger, action, excitement, and towards a greater mystery waiting to unfold.

Welcome to Tatters of the Titan Scroll, an action-packed adventure set in the Eberron campaign setting for Dungeons & Dragons! In this 6- to 8-hour scenario, characters are summoned by name to the chamber of a gynosphinx in the city of Sharn, where they are given a mysterious prophecy about the Titan Scroll and sent in search of its scattered pieces. Other parties also seek the tatters, however, posing danger and complications for the party in the streets of the City of Towers. The adventure is designed for a group of APL 1 characters, but can be adjusted to provide challenge for any Tier 1 party (levels 1 to 4).

boardgame.name: Jurassic World Alive
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Jurassic World Alive is an augmented-reality game that overlays various dinosaurs and locations on a "real world" map. The player location is determined by real-time GPS. Play involves moving around in the real world to encounter different dinosaur species which may then be examined to harvest DNA. Once sufficient DNA is collected from a given species, it can be "synthesized" in the laboratory, giving the player access to that dinosaur species. Advanced play allows existing species to be fused into new hybrid species that are stronger and faster.

A meta-game also exists, where the player's synthesized dinosaurs can be assembled into a team which then fights either a team at a given location, or a team assembled by another player.

Collecting DNA, synthesizing dinosaurs, and winning combats all yield in-game bonuses (which otherwise can be obtained through in-game purchases).

Then game often is compared to Pokémon GO, to which it is quite similar in many aspects of the play experience.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2019 Game Developers Choice Awards Best VR/AR Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Ross Rifles: Historical Roleplaying In the First World War (Preview Edition)
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book

From 1914 –1918, Canada played a major role in assisting the British Empire in winning one of the fiercest wars in history. But victory came at a cost. The First World War took the lives of over 60,000 Canadians. It was from this vast entanglement of international alliances, leaders, and agendas that Canada emerged as a modern fighting force on the brink of nationhood.

Ross Rifles is a tabletop roleplaying game that requires 3-5 players, one of whom will serve as the game master. In this game, you’ll create and inhabit the lives of soldiers from the Canadian Expeditionary Force (CEF) stationed on the Western Front. Sent overseas to fight for crown and country, your characters will make personal sacrifices in the name of Canada, and experience the horrors of industrialized war.

In the party game Silicon Valley Startups, you receive an absurd startup company by luck of the draw, then need to get creative to secure funding.

To get your company, draw a company name card that gives you guidelines to follow when creating that name, then draw a target user card and an industry card. From the introduction:

Honour Lite RPG allows you to enter the half-worlds of the shadows, the sideways worlds of the periphery, the worlds of myths and legends. It takes you into the near-future world of Asia's megacities, initially with a focus on Hong Kong. It is also a game steeped in supernatural lore. boardgame.name: Discovering America
boardgame.description:
Discovering America is a fun game that is derivative of MECC's famous Oregon Trail, but offers many innovations of its own.

Designed for children aged 8 and up, this adventure for children combines American history and geography in an exciting game. You are a Spanish explorer who has just set foot on America's shore. You will trudge through swamplands, deal with alligators, and battle time and the elements - all while building an exploration route through early America. As you (or your cihld) explore the New World and learns about its cultures and events, you will come across many factoids and interesting anecdotes that encompass a wide range of subjects, from (historical) survival tips, to Indian culture. As in Oregon Trail, you must always keep track of your resources and plan to replenish or trade them wisely, lest you perish in the harsh environment. Fortunately, Discovering America has no arcade elements, so those who were frustrated with Oregon Trail's many arcade sequences will be relieved.

Overall, this is a good product with very high production values that does achieve its aim, although not by innovation. Thumbs up!

boardgame.name: Ortho 4x4
boardgame.description:
This is the 4x4 version of the game Match 3+. It consists of 24 cards. There are four colours and four shapes. The colours are Blue, Red, Yellow, and green, and the shapes are Square, Circle, Triangle, and Diamond. Sixteen cards have coloured shapes, four cards have colours without shapes, and four cards have shapes without colour.
Each of the two players gets 12 cards. In turns, the players play a card with either the same shape or the same colour as the one played last on the pile.
When the players have no valid card to play, they pass.
When both players pass, the one who passed first can start afresh, playing any card s/he chooses.
Only a card with the same shape can be played on a card with a colourless shape.
Only a card with the same colour can be played on a card with a shapeless colour.
The winner is the player who first empties his/her hand.

—user summary

KEY FEATURES:

Base game and all expansions fit in one box
Three removable trays
Ten adjustable dividers
Supports sleeved and unsleeved cards


The Galactic Star Battle Organizer is compatible with Battlestar Galactica and features three removable trays and plenty of card storage. It supports all existing expansions in a single box (see below for details). Like all of Broken Token's organizers, it supports sleeved cards and comes with 10 adjustable dividers. Cards are stored at an angle to support even the largest card sleeves in the existing game box.

Notes on storing all expansions in a single box:

This organizer allows you to compress all three expansions and base game into a single box with a couple of caveats. As shown in the picture, Mayday standard sleeves are used for the large cards. Premium sleeves make for a tight fit and do not leave enough room for the wooden card dividers. Small cards are shown in premium sleeves and would allow for more dividers if using standard sleeves. The box lid closes all the way with all game boards and up to one manual. If all manuals are stored, the box lid may lift between 2 - 3mm.

This product is a kit that requires assembly. The use of wood glue (sold separately) is recommended.

This is a third-party accessory designed by The Broken Token. All product names are trademarks of their respective owners, which are in no way associated or affiliated with The Broken Token.

boardgame.name: 18ZOO
boardgame.description:
18ZOO is an 18xx game set in a fictional ZOO, designed for 2-4(5) players and playable in about 100 minutes:
- it is playable as a welcoming 18xx game, since many convention/rules are already in place, to let enter new players comfortably into the genre (i.e. they will find villages, dits, cities, shares, tokening, etc...)
- it is playable as the quickest knife fight among veterans/pro 18xxers: poisoned trains, few tiles, token battle, lot of incentives in buying train (+rust).

It's like 1860 and 1849 had a son which married the daughter of 18DIXIE and 18CZ. "Sweet like mommy and a bad boy like daddy" said the fairy godmother 1846

There are many features that makes it high ly distinguishable:

Map is modular- it can be combined and customized
All money of the game are multiple of 25$ (called a Bag of 25 Nuts).
No need to compute any division or percentage during the game
POWERS (privates) bend some rule in a FUN and exciting way - 16 out of 20 appear throughout the game
Companies are opened in a sort of ring order - first choice (and second choice) will set the game
RUN have a growing threshold in order to increase the stock value - the goal of route building is to be efficient throughout all ORs, instead of trying to achieve a local best run
Revenue of a RUN is pre-calculated - best run is an efficient run
Villages are called O (water pond), and their revenue is high since they give money into the treasury and to the run
Villages and Hills/Moutains (M and MM) are not upgradable (generally) so that route building is different in each game.


The goal of the design of 18ZOO is to have a game that last only 90-120 minutes, with the full narrative of a 18xx (both Stock Shenanigans and Operative Shenanigans), approachable by a wider audience (low calculus involved).

boardgame.name: Brotherhood
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The blood of the covenant is thicker than the water of the womb.

Brotherhoood is a mod for the Sigil System that gives your characters some friends, family and a home to call their own. Brotherhood is all about factions: creating them, playing with them, being part of them or working against them.

Brotherhood is about your characters a faction to be part of, to work towards something greater than just themselves and their party. In return, your characters will gain powerful bonuses by being able to rely on the might and wealth of their faction. You can call on your fellow brothers-in-arms to come help you, dip into your faction's piggy bank to help pay for that extra little something, fall back to your faction's safehouse to escape danger, and use your faction's network of members and contacts to help guide your travels. All is not moonshine and roses, however, as you'll have to manage your faction's notoriety out in the world and the treachery that is always brewing beneath the surface inside it.

Brotherhood is a mod (or addon) for the Sigil System, and so you will need the Sigil System in order to use it. However, if you want to simply create a faction for use in other systems, the faction generator will fit any game. Brotherhood is also setting-neutral so you can use it for any setting or genre that you can think of.

Inside the mod:

A full generator for building your faction's history alongside its skills and attributes
Rules for creating a base for your faction and how to upgrade and expand it during play
A system for recruiting prospects that subtly change your faction the more members you get
A mission system for sending your faction out on assignments
Random events that can destabilize your faction if not managed
Sample factions to start your campaign with

boardgame.name: Codetalk
코드톡
boardgame.description:
Compete to Cooperate, then Cooperate to Compete with Codetalk

WHAT IS CODETALK?

Codetalk is a unique strategic board game for 2 to 4 players. It combines the elements of Korean traditional game O-MOK and Color Match. Each player takes turns putting down their color chip on an empty grid. The player wins when the row of 3 chips are created. (Horizontally, Vertically, or Diagonally)

PREPARE GAME

Put the Grid-Board at the center of the table and choose your chip color. (Yellow, Red, Blue, Green). Make sure each color has 20 chips. Make a short game for your own to choose the first player. The game goes with a clockwise.

HOW TO PLAY


First player puts the chip on the grid. Make sure you tell other players of your number. (It’s called ‘rule setting’)
The number is now became a new rule where the next player has to put the chip on the particular Grid-Board No. told by the first player. Then, the player puts the chip on any number of the grid for a new rule setting.
Repeat Step 1 and 2 till the game ends.


END THE GAME

The game chooses the winner when a player firstly create 3 chips in a row. It can be horizontal, vertical or diagonal. It is up to you!

We draw the game if all chips are gone while no one created the row. Then, we restart the game!

boardgame.name: Pirkan polku
boardgame.description:
Translated for back of the book:
PIRKAN POLKU (eng. PATH OF PIRKKA)
Virtual life in Finland during the Viking Age

Pirkan polku -gamebook offers you a new and interesting way of moving straight to year 987, late iron age world. Pirkan polku brings to you an imaginary, ancient character, Pirkka. With him you can venture into real viking age environment in the village of Birckala, where you can experience feelings and happenings in from the life of people from that age.

Pirkan polku -gamebook is designed by Risto Hieta, a living legend of Finnish roleplaying. The witty randomization system he uses enables Pirkka's path to genereta differently every time and thus the unfolding story will be new every time you play.

Pirkan polku suits all ages, children as well as adults. It also works to support teaching in schools. The gamebook is easy to use and it contains interesting facts about our home country's ancient history written in enticing and vivid stories. The historical world introduced by the book is created together with experts to be as real as possible, precisely from the viewpoint of the people living in that age.

To use the gamebook a single 6-sided die is needed.

Back of the book in Finnish:
PIRKAN POLKU
Virtuaalielämää viikinkiajan Suomessa

Pirkan polku -pelikirja tarjoaa sinulle uudenlaisen ja kiinnostavan tavan siirtyä suoraan vuoteen 987, myöhäisrautakauden maailmaan. Pirkan polku tuo seuraksesi kuvitteellisen muinaishahmon, Pirkan. Hänen mukanaan pääset kulkemaan aitoon viikinkiaikaiseen ympäristöön Birckalan kylään, jossa voit kokea tunnelmia ja tapahtumia tuon aja ihmisten elämästä.

Pirkan polku -pelikirjan on suunnitellut Risto Hieta, suomalaisen roolipelaamisen elävä legenda. Hänen käyttämänsä nokkelan satunnaissysteemin ansiosta Pirkan polku muodostuu joka kerta erilaiseksi - ja näin myös tarina syntyy aina uutena.

Pirkan polku sopii kaikenikäisille, niin lapsille kuin aikuisille. Myös opetuksen tueksi se soveltuu mainiosti. Pelikirja on helppokäyttöinen, ja se sisältää kiinnostavaa tietoa kotimaamme muinaisajasta erinomaisen elävästi kirjoitettuna. Kirjan esittelemä historiallinen maailma on asiantuntijoiden avulla luotu mahdollisimman aidontuntuiseksi, nimenomaan tuon ajan ihmisen kannalta katsottuna.

Pelikirjan käyttämiseen tarvitaan yksi tavallinen 6-tahoinen noppa.

boardgame.name: Worldbuilding Power: Celestials
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Use the highest order of good beings in character development, worldbuilding, and adventures!

Divine beings don’t get the attention they deserve in fantasy roleplaying games. They should somehow play a larger role than they do in the cosmology of our favorite fictional universes, given that they are the extraplanar exemplars of all that is right and good in the multiverse. As with many other categories of creatures in combat-focused systems, I suspect that they remain out of the spotlight because it’s hard to justify fighting them. They’re not monsters, and there are usually in-game repercussions to throwing down on angels, unicorns, and the like.

One way to fix that is to incorporate celestials into the worldbuilding. Deities are a reality in many fantasy worlds, and these beings are their intermediaries. Throughout history, celestials have appeared to warm people of impeding disasters, to espouse opinions on wars, and the deliver bits of prophecy. They might even show up to actually help the well-intentioned mortals who share their moral and ethical views. If demons and devils interfere and try to skew the world toward evil, why would the celestials not take an active role in promoting the power of good?

In this book, we’ll show you how to utilize these virtuous outsiders in your worldbuilding endeavors. You’ll see how they can influence character, setting, and story elements. By the end, you’ll understand how to make celestials into an essential, useful, and entertaining part of your campaign.

boardgame.name: Lifeguard
boardgame.description:
Lifeguard is a cooperative game for 2-4 players; these players are a team of lifeguards at a crowded and chaotic outdoor pool, trying to prevent hazards and save any victims before it's too late.

The players create the shape and depth of their own pool; each zone in the pool fills and empties throughout the game with different risks, hazards, and victims in the form of facedown cards. The guards work furiously to flip over these cards and then work together to deal with whatever emergencies they uncover. Any waste of time results in more facedown cards in their pool, which means any unseen victims' conditions are growing more and more serious, making them harder to save.

In addition to the pool itself, the players can customize the difficulty of the game by adding more hazards or victims into the deck, as well as choose special characters and special abilities for themselves.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: ROKURIGO
boardgame.description:
ROKURIGO is a two-player abstract strategy game that contains elements of Reversi.

The playing area is a 6x6 grid, although players will be placing their pieces only in the central twenty spaces. Each player has three types of double-sided pieces that mirror the numbers you find on opposite sides of a standard six-sided die: 1/6, 2/5, and 3/4, with five of each piece. Some numbers are printed on the game board.

Players take turns placing a piece on the game board. You can freely place one of your pieces in the four central spaces or on the second-closest row of the game board. If you want to place a piece elsewhere, though, you must "sandwich" a piece Reversi-style in order to flip it. You need to track the sum of numbers visible because if you bring the total to 33, then you capture one of the opponent's pieces. If you bring the total to 37 or more, then you lose the game instantly, so think carefully before you flip something!

boardgame.description:
For The Greater Good is the third Mythos Pack in The Circle Undone cycle for Arkham Horror: The Card Game.

Following the events of The Wages of Sin, you are disturbed to learn that there have been even more strange sightings in Arkham and worse, several more people have disappeared. You need help. Your relationship with the Order of the Silver Twilight cannot continue to balance on the edge of a knife. You must decide whether you will place your trust in them or count them among your enemies, and this decision will shape your adventure moving forward, determining your ties to the Lodge and which areas of the manor you will have access to.

At first glance, several of the player cards featured in For the Greater Good may look familiar. In The Secret Name, the Arkham Horror LCG broke the boundary between player factions by introducing player cards that belonged to multiple classes. Now, as your investigators continue to gain experience from their research into Arkham’s secret history, you will have the chance to upgrade these cards into more powerful versions that fit into classic, single-class categories. Each version of these upgraded cards feature distinct art pieces and abilities that play into the core focuses of their classes, growing with your investigators as their search for answers continue.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: La La La Alien
ラララうちゅう (Ra ra ra uchû)
boardgame.description:
User summary
ラララうちゅう (Ra ra ra uchû) La La La Alien is a set collection card game in which you collect aliens.

Aliens have crash landed on earth and you need to help them find the others from the same planet. Your points increase as you gather aliens of the same type, and there other other scoring opportunities based on their color.

Each round you may either exchange cards twice between your hand and the face-up supply or exchange your entire hand for the supply. The game ends after three rounds, which means you will only take a maximum of six moves in the entire game and you must watch the other players carefully to determine the best move to take.

The basics of this game are taken from a card game called 51 that is fairly well-known in Japan but not outside of it.

Publisher's summary
『ラララうちゅう』は、宇宙人を集めるセットコレクションのカードゲームです。地球に不時着した宇宙人たち。同じ星の仲間を探すのを手伝ってあげましょう。
同じ星の仲間の宇宙人を集めると、得点が増えます。宇宙人の色によって、いくつかの得点方法があります。１ラウンドでは、手札と場札の交換を２回ずつ行います。手札と場札を”総替え”することもできます。それを３ラウンド繰り返してゲーム終了となります。つまり、最大でのたったの６手しかありません。相手の動きをよく観察して、機敏な１手を指しましょう。

boardgame.name: Whale Train
でんしゃクジラ (Densha Kujira)
boardgame.description:
User summary
でんしゃクジラ (Densha Kujira) Whale Train is a card game with the same appeal as Mah Jong or Rummy. Pulling cards from the deck, the winner is the first to be able to make sets with all nine cards in their hand.

The rhino, goat, and alligator sets each consist of two cards, the whale of three cards, and the train and bullet train of three or more cars linked together in ever longer combinations. There are various routes to victory, collecting all the same color, focusing on all whale cards, or the legendary move of playing your entire hand all at once as a bullet train.

It’s a card game you can replay many times in different ways.

Publisher's summary
『でんしゃクジラ』は、麻雀をずっと親しみやすくしたような、カードゲームです。
山札からカードを引いて、自分のカード９枚すべてをセットにすると勝ちです。
２枚でセットになる、サイ・ヤギ・ワニ。３枚でセットになる、クジラ。３枚以上でセットになる、でんしゃと新幹線。でんしゃと新幹線は車両をつなげることでどんどん長くできます。
いくつかの役があります。すべて同じ色だったり、全部クジラだったりすると、ちょっと良い点でアガれます。 シンカンセンイッキという伝説の役も。
何度も繰り返し遊べるカードゲームです。

boardgame.name: Visioo
boardgame.description:
In Visioo, every player has to prove their perception skills. The stack of cards is divided in equal parts for each player. Then every player flips a card at the same time. The cards are put side by side in the middle of the table. Now every player tries to find two objects that are the same, but differ in color – as soon as this happens, the player that has found a couple wins the cards.

There is however not always a couple to find. If after a couple of moments the players agree to not find anything, everyone flips another card and puts it next to the other ones. Now there are more cards to look at, but thus also more cards to win or lose! Pressure is up!

In the end, the player with the most cards wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Tiwanaku
boardgame.description:
It is said that Wiraqocha created the sun and the pre-Columbian tribes of the Andes. Under his leadership, those who will train the mighty Inca people came out of their caves to discover new horizons in order to subsist and grow in harmony with nature. They venerated Pachamama, Mother Earth, the basis of all living things, plants and minerals, on earth and under the earth.

In Tiwanaku, first announced as Pachamama, you lead your tribe into unknown territory in search of new lands to cultivate. Your goal: To explore regions and draw outlines to develop cultures according to the customs and legacies of Pachamama. If you honor Her by respecting the great principles of diversity and complementarity, Nature will reward you; otherwise, you will suffer his wrath. In this race, risk-taking, deduction, intuition, and a good sense of timing should allow you to get through.

Each scenario disc indicates a unique arrangement of terrain tiles and crop tiles. Terrain tiles are in regions of 1-5 spaces, and a region of one color does not touch a region of the same color, even diagonally. Crop tokens have a value of 1-5, and each value has a different size/color (level 1 is brown, level 2 is green, etc.). A size 1 region will contain a value 1 crop token, a size 2 region will contain crop tokens of value 1 and 2, and only a size 5 region will contain crop tokens of each value. Two identical crop values can never be adjacent, even diagonally.

On a turn, take either an explore action or a divine action: At the end of an explore or divine action, you can hand in 1-5 offering cubes for 0-10 points. You can hold at most one offering of each color.

When the final terrain tile is placed on the game board, the end of the game is triggered. Starting with this player, each player in turn can take a single divine action or pass. If you pass, you take no further actions. If you divine, you gain points and an offering cube like normal, or you lose points and must pass. Keep taking turns around the table until everyone has passed, then make a final offering, then see who has the most points.

Всё на ладони
boardgame.description:
Palm Reader is divided into several rounds, and in each round the active player draws a card and randomly chooses one of five symbols on it. This player then draws that symbol on the palm of the person sitting to their left, while that person has their eyes closed. You receive as many victory points as the number of players in a row who successfully guess the symbol.

boardgame.name: Arisu Asemburu
アリスアセンブル (Alice Assemble)
boardgame.description:
User summary
アリスアセンブル (Arisu Asemburu) Alice Assemble is a Japanese game.

In the game of Alice Assemble, players are machinists who build an automaton doll by co-ordinating several gears.

At the beginning of each round, a number of cards, which depicts gears, are revealed on the table. Each turn, you place the card, which you have previously taken, in front of you. Then you take a card from the table.

At end of the game, players score victory points depending on patterns of gears they coordinated. You score big points by making a larger chunk of connected gears.

If you took a card with a smaller number in your previous turn, you take your turn earlier. On the other hand, a card with a larger number has more gears than the smaller one in general.

You should consider your opponents' intentions when you take your card, and make full use of the card when you build your doll.

Publisher's summary
『アリスアセンブル』は、機械の街の工匠となり、歯車を組み合わせて自動人形の少女を組み上げるゲームです。

プレイヤーは、場に公開される歯車の書かれたカードを獲得し、手元に並べていきます。
手元のカードの列は、ゲーム終了時、そこに書かれた歯車のパターンに応じて得点となります。
より大きな歯車の塊を作り、組み上げた人形により優れた機能を与えることで、高い得点を得ることができます。

手番で取得したカードに振られた番号が若ければ、次のラウンドでより早く手番が回ってきます。
そして、歯車の多いカードには大きな番号が振られる傾向にあります。
ほかのプレイヤーの動向を見据えてカードを獲得し、それを巧みに組み上げることが勝利の鍵となります！

boardgame.name: We Need to Talk
boardgame.description:
A Game of Staging Ridiculous Interventions about Nonsensical Problems.

Caring friends and family have all gathered “because they LOVE you”. That’s how it always starts. That’s when you suddenly realize there’s a problem - and it’s YOU. You’re shocked and clueless, which is why your loved ones have taken it upon themselves to carefully broach the subject. Naturally, no one wants to just come right out and say it. So they keep hinting at it, hoping you’ll catch on eventually. But will you? Or will this Intervention fail?

In this game, players take turns being the focus of an intervention by drawing a Problem card with a nonsensical problem like, "Uncontrollable Interpretive Dancing" or "Neurotic Inability to Turn Right". They can't see the card, but all the Concerned Friends and Family can. Friends will give obscure clues that hint at the problem, without giving it away. The sooner the Intervened can guess the problem, the more points they'll score. The longer the Concerned Friends keep them guessing, the more points the Friends can earn. Each of the three rounds have a unique format for giving clues, Broaching the Subject, The Emotional Appeal and Offering a Solution. But if the Intervened cannot guess their problem by the end of the third round, no one will score any points, having failed to help their friend.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dark City
boardgame.description:
Don’t let the dim light of the full moon mislead you. Tonight Dark City is shadow territory. Monsters prowl the streets, craving for blood, and they’ll do anything to keep their hunting grounds. Humankind has its guardians, however few and far between, and they fight for their lives with matching ferocity. Who will survive another showdown on the gloomy streets of Dark City?

Dark City is a party game in which players choose iconic characters from the cast of a horror movie – vampires, werewolves, zombies, hunters, priests – then face their opponents in a fierce battle of wits, inference and finger-pointing.

Every round, the Acting Player randomly discards three cards from the deck. Then, one by one, players draft a monster or guardian at their choice from among the remaining cards. Players attack their chosen target by aiming their monster’s or guardian’s signature gesture at it. Then players have a chance to flee the battle, trying to prevent their opponents from scoring. Attacks are resolved in initiative order. Successful attacks “kill” their targets and allow players to achieve their monster’s or guardian’s goals. Players whose monsters or guardians have “survived” the encounter and achieved their goals score experience points (XP).The game ends when one or more players gather enough XP to meet at least one of the four victory conditions.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Conspiracy: The Solomon Gambit
boardgame.description:
The briefcase is out in the open, and six freelance agents are in the field.

In Conspiracy: The Solomon Gambit, a restoration of the 1973 classic game Conspiracy, players vie for control of the agents by secretly paying them off and using them to move the briefcase across Europe, trying to get it to their HQ. But other players can challenge and stop an agent from moving if they have paid more than you — and for the right price they can even assassinate another agent.

In addition to a slick new look, this restored edition offers two new twists on the original gameplay. First, each agent has a unique ability that lets them move an agent or the briefcase for free. Second, an alternate win condition eliminates stalling and potential stalemates. If no one wins within a certain number of turns, Dr. Solomon can end the game immediately, and whoever has paid off the most to him wins the game. However, if you pay off too much to Dr. Solomon early in the game, that can leave you with little control over the other agents, forcing you to strike a tricky balance between immediate and long-term goals.

—description from the publisher

[size=14][b]Payment Options:[/b][/size]
[size=12][b]Paypal:[/b][/size] No fee is charged to you, if you pay using Paypal. But Paypal does not change currency at the fair market rate. So you will lose 3% or more of your money, if you are converting to Euros.
[size=12][b]IBAN Bank Transfer:[/b][/size] Payment by bank transfer is possible using an IBAN compatible account. [b]There is a 3% discount if you pay using IBAN Bank Transfer[/b] (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less).
[size=12][b]Wise:[/b][/size] There is a 3% discount if you pay using Wise (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). The company does currency conversion at the fair market rate, and charges the sender a fee of about 0.5% of the amount of money sent.
[size=12][b]Revolut:[/b][/size] There is a 3% discount if you pay using Revolut (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). The company does currency conversion at the fair market rate, and there are no fees to send money.
[size=12][b]Interac e-transfer:[/b][/size] If you have a Canadian bank account (like me), then you can pay by Interac e-transfer. In this case, you pay in Canadian dollars, at the fair market exchange rate. There is also a 3% discount, if you pay using Interac e-transfer (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less).
[size=12][b]Local Pickup:[/b][/size] If you live near Siegen, Germany, local pickup is also possible, with a 3% discount for cash payment.
[size=12][b]Payment in Dollars:[/b][/size] It is possible to make Paypal payments in US or Canadian dollars, at the fair market exchange rate. You will automatically receive this option, if your address is in the USA or Canada.
[size=14][b]I take responsibility for the safe delivery of your order:[/b][/size] I am a registered commercial seller. Thus, insofar as you are a private consumer, it is required by German law that I take responsibility for any loss or damage of goods that occurs during shipment.

boardgame.name: Moonglow
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the latter half of the 21st century, humanity begins the colonization of space by establishing a permanent manned outpost on the rim of Shackleton Crater, at the lunar South Pole. But when contact with the previous crew is lost, it is now up to a new team of brave explorers to find out what happened...and why the moonbase has suddenly gone silent.

Moonglow is a short near-future scenario set on the moon.
